message.content:
Here is a simple Python function using the openpyxl library to read data from an Excel spreadsheet. You can install openpyxl using pip: `pip install openpyxl`.

```python
import openpyxl

def read_excel(file_path, sheet_name):
    # Open the Excel file
    wb = openpyxl.load_workbook(file_path)

    # Get the specified sheet
    sh = wb[sheet_name]

    # Read all data from the sheet
    data = sh.values

    # Return the data as a list of lists (rows)
    return [row for row in data]
```

You can use this function like this:

```python
file_path = "example.xlsx"  # Replace with your Excel file path
sheet_name = "Sheet1"       # Replace with the name of the sheet you want to read from

data = read_excel(file_path, sheet_name)

print(data)
```
This will print all the data in the specified sheet as a list of lists (rows).
